This has been out for a while, but I haven't been able to see it yet. I realize that a summer Saturday night is often too crowded for movie-going, at least if the weather is good, but I thought I'd take a chance. I will cancel if nobody else is interested; Saturday is the only day I can see it. Feel free to go a different day if you can, it's showing Wednesday-Saturday.


WINTER'S BONE (R) (2010)
Directed by Debra Granik. Screenplay by Debra Granik and Anne Rosellini, based on the novel by Daniel Woodrell. Cast: Jennifer Lawrence, John Hawkes, Dale Dickey.
The winner of this year's the Sundance Festival's Grand Jury Prize for Drama is the second movie by exciting indie filmmaker Debra Granik. Made on a bare-bones budget - and all the freedom that can buy - Winter's Bone is a near-mythical epic of a 17-year old girl (the amazing Jennifer Lawrence) who dreams of escaping the grueling poverty - and her meth-dealing relatives - in the Ozarks. First, however, she sets off on a dangerous journey to find her missing father, who has put their home up as bond. The haunting soundtrack features local Ozark musicians and composer Dickon Hinchliffe, formerly of Tindersticks).
"Winter's Bone is what we've been waiting for: a work of art that grabs hold and won't let go." - David Denby, The New Yorker.
100 min. http://www.wintersbon...
